response_requirements.initial_response_description: Agencies must respond within 10 working days (Monday-Friday, excluding state holidays)
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Agency may extend response by up to 10 additional working days with written notice
response_requirements.extension_notes: May request additional extensions beyond initial 10-day extension with requestor agreement
response_requirements.working_day_definition: Monday through Friday, excluding state holidays

fee_structure.search_fee: Actual personnel costs after first 2 person-hours per calendar month
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: First 2 person-hours of search and copying time per calendar month are free
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: $0.25 per page if agency makes copies; reasonable fee for use of equipment if requestor makes copies
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Actual cost of providing electronic records, may not exceed agency's actual cost
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: First 2 person-hours per calendar month are provided at no charge
fee_structure.prepayment_notes: Agency may require payment before beginning search if work will exceed 2 person-hours

exemptions.description: Medical and related public health records of individuals
Records required to be kept confidential by federal law or regulation or by state law

Records compiled for law enforcement purposes that could interfere with proceedings, deprive fair trial rights, invade privacy, disclose confidential sources, reveal techniques/procedures, or endanger safety
Confidential financial information, including procedures or security measures for collection or processing of negotiable instruments
Records of vital statistics and adoption proceedings (governed by AS 18.50)
Academic records of students (governed by AS 14.03.160)
Records specifically exempted from disclosure by state law
Records of library users (governed by AS 14.56.340)
Records pertaining to location of archaeological, prehistoric, or historic sites if disclosure might damage or threaten the site
Emergency evacuation and emergency response plans if disclosure would threaten public safety
Critical infrastructure information relating to energy, waste, telecommunications, emergency services, electromagnetic spectrum, or chemical processing
Records about individuals submitted to Alaska Police Standards Council (with exceptions for certification, decertification, and basic officer information)

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Most agencies provide administrative appeal procedures; vary by agency. Only written requests have administrative remedy.
appeal_process.second_level: Superior Court appeal from final administrative order
appeal_process.second_level_deadline_notes: Must file within 30 days of receiving notice of final administrative order
appeal_process.judicial_enforcement: Direct application to superior court for records access order
appeal_process.judicial_enforcement_notes: May apply to court within 180 days of denial without exhausting administrative remedies
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award costs and reasonable attorney fees to applicant if court orders records made available
appeal_process.burden_of_proof: Agency must prove by preponderance of evidence that record is exempt

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No requirement to state purpose or identify self
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: May be made orally or in writing; only written requests have administrative remedy for denials
requester_requirements.specific_format: Must describe records in sufficient detail to enable agency to locate them; must specify whether examination, copies, or both

agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: Records available at reasonable times under reasonable conditions and under supervision by custodian or designee
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: Requests may be filed at nearest office of agency
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Electronic format when records exist electronically and can be retrieved with reasonable effort
agency_obligations.electronic_format_requirements: Must provide in requested electronic format if exists or can be produced with reasonable effort; otherwise provide in format maintained
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Must segregate confidential portions and make available non-confidential parts
agency_obligations.balancing_test_required: Agency must determine that need for confidentiality outweighs public interest in disclosure
public_interest_factors: Reveal waste, fraud, abuse, or wrongdoing

oversight_body.name: Alaska Department of Law
oversight_body.role: Provides APRA guidance; no formal oversight authority
oversight_body.notes: No central enforcement authority; compliance through administrative appeals and court system

official_resources.request_portal_notes: Individual agencies may maintain their own request systems

primary_sources: Alaska Statutes Title 40, Chapter 25, Sections 40.25.110 through 40.25.125
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from statutory text. Alaska uses 'working days' (Monday-Friday, excluding holidays) for response timelines. First 2 person-hours of search/copy time per month are free. Unique balancing test requires agencies to weigh public interest against confidentiality. Two paths to judicial relief: administrative appeal process or direct court application within 180 days of denial.
unique_characteristics: Balancing test weighs public interest vs confidentiality need
Two judicial pathways: appeal or direct enforcement
Electronic records available if retrievable with reasonable effort
Only written requests have administrative remedy
